Why am I getting an error when trying to use vertcat?
<p>I'm getting an error when trying to use <code>vertcat</code> to concatenate two matrices. How can I concatenate this matrix</p> <pre><code>text = Columns 1 through 6 'GL/GG' 'go' 'vc (m/min)' 'fz (mm)' 'Fx (N)' 'Fy (N)' '[]' '[]' '[]' '[]' '[]' '[]' Columns 7 through 9 'd (째)' 'MA (%)' 'V (%)' '[]' '[]' '[]' </code></pre> <p>which is 2-by-9, with another matrix that includes double values and is 96-by-9.</p> <p>I don't understand why there is a problem with this <code>vertcat</code> function. As far as I can tell, <code>c = vertcat(text,text)</code> works fine:</p> <pre><code> Columns 1 through 6 'GL/GG' 'go' 'vc (m/min)' 'fz (mm)' 'Fx (N)' 'Fy (N)' '[]' '[]' '[]' '[]' '[]' '[]' 'GL/GG' 'go' 'vc (m/min)' 'fz (mm)' 'Fx (N)' 'Fy (N)' '[]' '[]' '[]' '[]' '[]' '[]' Columns 7 through 9 'd (째)' 'MA (%)' 'V (%)' '[]' '[]' '[]' 'd (째)' 'MA (%)' 'V (%)' '[]' '[]' '[]' </code></pre> <p>What should I do?</p> <p>Columns 1 through 6</p> <pre><code> 1 0 1 0 0.65318 0.045977 1 0.2 0.42857 1 0.46243 0.21264 0 0 0.42857 0.4 0.023121 0.26437 0 0.2 0.14286 0.4 0.10405 0.41954 0 0.2 1 0.4 0.14451 0.29577 0.625 0.76543 0.64789 0.22917 0.35802 0.64789 0.22917 0.30864 0.52113 0.1875 0.17284 0.90141 0.10417 0.5679 0.47887 0.52083 0.81481 0.84507 0.375 0.65432 0.49296 0.29167 0.77778 0.57746 0.22917 0.93827 0.49296 0.22917 0.80247 0.29577 0.25 0.7037 0.57746 0.33333 0.16049 0.15493 0.58333 0.34568 0.84507 0.10417 0.20988 0.61972 0.29167 0.35802 0.42254 0.375 0.32099 0.52113 0.083333 0.18519 0.4507 0.58333 0.39506 0.47887 0.25 0.92593 1 0.33333 0.5679 0.22535 0.39583 0.66667 0.19718 0.1875 </code></pre>
<p>You can only concatenate vertical arrays (of type string) if they are the equal size i.e. the rows and columns must be identical. A similar question was answer here - <a href="http://math.stackexchange.com/questions/449791/why-do-i-keep-getting-a-vertcat-error-in-matlab">http://math.stackexchange.com/questions/449791/why-do-i-keep-getting-a-vertcat-error-in-matlab</a>. May be this will help you understand what you are up against?</p> <p>A tip for you would be to pad the difference using white-space " "? This will make sure that you have an equal size array to work with. HOwever, I don't know the parameters of your operation, so using " " as a padding element may affect what you are trying to achieve.</p>
<p>The problem is that your <code>text</code> matrix is in fact a <a href="http://www.mathworks.com/help/matlab/cell-arrays.html" rel="nofollow">cell array</a> where as your matrix of doubles is just a regular double matrix. In order to do the concatenation you first need to convert your array of doubles to a cell array where each element is in a separate cell (i.e. a <em>96</em>-by-<em>9</em> cell array). To do this you use <a href="http://www.mathworks.com/help/matlab/ref/mat2cell.html?refresh=true" rel="nofollow"><code>mat2cell</code></a>:</p> <pre><code>text = { 'GL/GG', 'go', 'vc (m/min)', 'fz (mm)', 'Fx (N)', 'Fy (N)', 'd (째)', 'MA (%)', 'V (%)'; '[]', '[]', '[]', '[]', '[]', '[]', '[]', '[]', '[]'}; num = rand(96,9); vertcat(text, mat2cell(num, ones(size(num,1),1), ones(1,size(num,2)))); </code></pre>
